Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information
III.1)Conditions relating to the contract
III.1.1)Deposits and guarantees required:
III.1.2)Main financing conditions and payment arrangements and/or reference to the relevant provisions governing them:
III.1.3)Legal form to be taken by the group of economic operators to whom the contract is to be awarded:
III.1.4)Other particular conditions
The performance of the contract is subject to particular conditions: yes
Description of particular conditions: Frontex seeks an integrated solution that can take the role of a digital workplace addressing all common tasks of Frontex staff regardless if they work in the HQ or remotely. Therefore the intention is to gradually reduce the number of proposed solutions discussed during the competitive dialogue stage in order to reach a max. of 3–4 economic operators that will be invited to submit proposals in the final tender stage. For that purpose, Frontex will first review the replies to the descriptive document from the tenderers. Then, Frontex will request clarifications and demonstrations of the features of the offered solutions during interactive meetings (remote sessions will be allowed). Later Frontex may request to run live system reviews by the Frontex project team itself (in-cloud demo installation will be accepted) based on the requirements published in the descriptive document. Eventually Frontex will prepare final tender documentation and will perform the final assessment of the submitted offers to award the winning contractor.
III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: Required proof that the tenderer is authorised to perform the contract under a national law, as evidenced by inclusion in a trade or professional register, or a sworn declaration or certificate or membership of a specific organisation.
Participation in this tendering procedure is exceptionally open on equal terms to all natural and legal persons from all countries.
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: Proof of possessing a gold-level partnership with Microsoft.
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
a) Tenderer's free format self-declaration of capability for selling, implementing, customising, developing custom extensions, providing trainings, providing on-the-spot support and maintaining COTS extension to SP (see the definitions included in the descriptive document).
b) Tenderer's declaration on Frontex template (see Appendix 2 to the descriptive document) that the offered COTS extension to SP is already developed, offered to market, available for in-premise installations and extends the OOTB SP functionalities by new features, behaviour or better user experience at least in the following scope:
1) reading and publication of corporate news;
2) linking and launching corporate applications and other portals;
3) discovering and maintaining user profiles, contact data and corporate organisational structure;
4) personalisation;
5) branding;
6) availability on mobile platforms (iPads and iPhones);
7) management of the COTS extension to SP.
c) Tenderer's free format catalogue describing all the functionalities of the offered COTS extension to SP.
d) A list of at least 15 customers using the offered COTS extension to SP indicating the number of users of these installations.
e) A list of at least 3 successful projects delivered in the past 3 years that implement an intranet solution based on OOT SP and components included in the offered COTS extension to SP and at least 1 of the projects which was delivered in Europe.
f) CVs of available tenderer's human resources foreseen for performance of the prospective contract in the following profiles defined in the descriptive document: 1 project manager, 1 business analyst, 1 MS SharePoint architect, 2 senior SharePoint developers, 2 junior SharePoint developers, 1 SharePoint GUI designer and an expert in the area of search and taxonomies that can be covered by one of the already listed profiles or a separate team member.
III.2.4)Information about reserved contracts
III.3)Conditions specific to services contracts
III.3.1)Information about a particular profession

II.1.2)Type of contract and location of works, place of delivery or of performance
Services
Service category No 22: Personnel placement and supply services
Main site or location of works, place of delivery or of performance: Frontex' office, Plac Europejski 6, 00-844 Warsaw, POLAND.

NUTS code PL127 Miasto Warszawa
II.1.3)Information about a public contract, a framework agreement or a dynamic purchasing system (DPS)
The notice involves the establishment of a framework agreement
II.1.4)Information on framework agreement
Framework agreement with several operators
maximum number of participants to the framework agreement envisaged: 3

Duration of the framework agreement
Duration in years: 4

Estimated total value of purchases for the entire duration of the framework agreement
Estimated value excluding VAT:
Range: between 500 000 and 1 000 000 EUR
II.1.5)Short description of the contract or purchase(s)
Frontex may need interim staff as a replacement or a complement to its statutory staff, in the following situations:
to replace staff absent due to maternity leave, parental leave, sickness or other reasons;
to cope with peak periods which require additional workforce for a fixed period of time;
to carry out, on a temporary basis, tasks resulting from specific projects, which are additional to the ordinary ones;
to carry out, on a temporary basis, tasks which require specific competences which are not available within Frontex.
The overall objective of the contract is to provide Frontex with the necessary interim personnel in a timely manner and in line with the requested job profiles.
II.1.6)Common procurement vocabulary (CPV)

79600000 Recruitment services
II.1.7)Information about Government Procurement Agreement (GPA)
The contract is covered by the Government Procurement Agreement (GPA): no
II.1.8)Lots
This contract is divided into lots: no
II.1.9)Information about variants
Variants will be accepted: no
II.2)Quantity or scope of the contract
II.2.1)Total quantity or scope:
The contract will be concluded for 2 years with a possibility of 1 or 2 1-year extensions for a total period not exceeding 48 months.
The total indicative number of man-months per year is estimated to be 120 (approximately 10 persons providing services throughout the whole calendar year).
Estimated value excluding VAT:
Range: between 500 000 and 1 000 000 EUR
II.2.2)Information about options
Options: no
II.2.3)Information about renewals
This contract is subject to renewal: yes
Number of possible renewals: Range: between 1 and 2
In the case of renewable supplies or service contracts, estimated timeframe for subsequent contracts:
in months: 24 (from the award of the contract)
II.3)Duration of the contract or time limit for completion
Duration in months: 48 (from the award of the contract)

Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information
III.1)Conditions relating to the contract
III.1.1)Deposits and guarantees required:
No deposits or guarantees are required.
III.1.2)Main financing conditions and payment arrangements and/or reference to the relevant provisions governing them:
Payments under the contract shall be made according to the time sheets against monthly invoices within 30 days of receipt of the relevant invoice submitted by the contractor (and only if the contractor has fulfilled all his contractual obligations by the date on which the invoice is submitted to Frontex).
The invoice has to be accompanied by a copy of the time sheets approved by Frontex.
The invoices shall be issued for each calendar month.
III.1.3)Legal form to be taken by the group of economic operators to whom the contract is to be awarded:
No special legal form is required but, in the event a group of contractors submits an acceptable offer, it shall be necessary to provide an undertaking that each company shall be jointly and severally responsible for the due performance of the contract. In the case of a consortium bid, the contractor shall be required to act on behalf of the consortium.
III.1.4)Other particular conditions
The performance of the contract is subject to particular conditions: no
III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: The tenderer shall declare by means of Annex IV that none of the exclusion criteria apply.
The tenderer shall provide evidence that it is already established as a recognised legal entity and is registered in a relevant professional or trade register.
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: The tenderer shall provide evidence of its economic and financial capacity to perform the contract as follows:
the tenderer should provide a declaration of the total turnover and the turnover on the services specified in the contract carried out over the past 3 financial years. The total annual turnover shall be at least (equivalent of) 250 000 EUR for each year: 2013 and 2014.
Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required: — The total annual turnover shall be at least (equivalent of) 250 000 EUR for each year: 2013 and 2014.
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
The tenderer shall provide evidence of its technical and professional capacity to perform the contract as follows:
a) the tenderer should be established as a recognised legal entity and be registered in a relevant professional or trade register. The proof of establishment/registration indicating the authorisation to perform the services to be contracted must be provided;
b) the tenderer must have proven experience and expertise as well as HR capacity as provider of interim staff or similar (e.g. personnel placement, recruitment, etc.) services for a minimum of 2 years, which shall be evidenced by:
a brief description of the company's profile;
description of the experience in the provision of interim staffing services in the field of administration, preferably in an international environment;
a tenderer's statement of tenderer's database capacity (how many potential candidates the contractor currently has in the database);
a tenderer’s statement on the number of interim staff outsourced/placed during the last 2 years (year 2013 and year 2014); the minimum required number is 30 per year;
information about similar contracts, supported by at least 3 reference letters issued in the name of the tenderer from clients for whom similar services have been provided in the last 3 years.
Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required:
The tenderer must have proven experience and expertise as well as HR capacity as a provider of interim staff or similar (e.g. personnel placement, recruitment, etc.) services for a minimum of 2 years.
The minimum required number of interim staff outsourced/placed during the last 2 years (year 2013 and year 2014) is 30 per year.
At least 3 reference letters issued in the name of the tenderer from clients for whom similar services have been provided in the last 3 years.

III.3)Conditions specific to services contracts

NUTS code PL127 Miasto Warszawa
II.1.3)Information about a public contract, a framework agreement or a dynamic purchasing system (DPS)
The notice involves the establishment of a framework agreement
II.1.4)Information on framework agreement
Framework agreement with a single operator

Duration of the framework agreement
Duration in years: 4

Estimated total value of purchases for the entire duration of the framework agreement
Estimated value excluding VAT: 4 200 000 EUR
II.1.5)Short description of the contract or purchase(s)
The scope of the contract covers the provision of services and equipment related to ICT networks and audio/video systems.
II.1.6)Common procurement vocabulary (CPV)

72000000 IT services: consulting, software development, Internet and support
II.1.7)Information about Government Procurement Agreement (GPA)
The contract is covered by the Government Procurement Agreement (GPA): no
II.1.8)Lots
This contract is divided into lots: no
II.1.9)Information about variants
Variants will be accepted: no
II.2)Quantity or scope of the contract
II.2.1)Total quantity or scope:
This framework contract duration is: 2 years + 1 year + 1 year i.e. after the initial duration of 2 years the framework contract shall be automatically renewed no more than 2 times, each time for a period of 1 year and on the same conditions, unless one of the parties informs the other of its intention not to extend the framework contract and such notification is received by the party to which it is addressed, no later than 3 months before the contract expires. The overall duration of the framework contract may in no event exceed 4 years. The maximum value estimated for the whole duration of the framework contract is: 4 200 000 EUR.
Frontex reserves the right to conduct exceptional negotiated procedure based on Article 134.1(f) of Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) No 1268/2012 of 29.10.2012 (RAP) to increase the ceiling with the contractors of particular lot(s), if such a need occurs.
Estimated value excluding VAT:
Range: between 4 200 000 and 6 300 000 EUR
II.2.2)Information about options
Options: no
II.2.3)Information about renewals
This contract is subject to renewal: yes
Number of possible renewals: Range: between 1 and 2
II.3)Duration of the contract or time limit for completion
Duration in months: 48 (from the award of the contract)

Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information
III.1)Conditions relating to the contract
III.1.1)Deposits and guarantees required:
No deposits or guarantees are required.
III.1.2)Main financing conditions and payment arrangements and/or reference to the relevant provisions governing them:
Payments shall be executed only if the contractor has fulfilled all his contractual obligations by the date on which the invoice is submitted.
The relevant payments will be done in 30 days from the receipt of the invoice.
III.1.3)Legal form to be taken by the group of economic operators to whom the contract is to be awarded:
No special legal form is required but, in the event a group of contractors submits an acceptable offer, it shall be necessary to provide an undertaking that each company shall be jointly and severally responsible for the due performance of the contract. In the case of a consortium bid, the contractor shall be required to act on behalf of the consortium.
III.1.4)Other particular conditions
The performance of the contract is subject to particular conditions: no
III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: The tenderer shall declare by means of Annex III that none of the exclusion criteria apply.
The tenderer shall provide evidence that it is already established as a recognised legal entity and is registered in a relevant professional or trade register.
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: The tenderer shall provide evidence of its economic and financial capacity to perform the contract as follows:
a) the tenderer shall provide Frontex with its balance sheets for the past 3 financial years, on condition that the publication of balance sheets is stipulated by the legislation on firms in the country where the tenderer is established;
b) the tenderer shall provide Frontex with a declaration of the total turnover carried out over the past 3 years.
Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required: The 3-year sum of the tenderer's total turnover must amount to a minimum (equivalent) of 500 000 EUR.
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
The following documents and/or information shall be presented as evidence of compliance with the technical and professional capacity criteria:
a) the tenderer must be able to provide a team of consultants matching the requirements detailed in the relevant terms of reference document and its attachments. This must be done by means of completed personnel capacity declaration;
b) a list and a brief description of recent activities (in the last 3 years) in the field of the relevant lot, together with the list of contracts performed in the past 3 years, with sums, dates and recipients;
c) the tenderer shall supply descriptions/presentations of the projects, as described above.
Each description shall include at least the following information:
— details of the client (name, address, contact details),
— number of users,
— functionalities,
— high-level description of the solution architecture,
— budget involved,
— any other relevant information considered as necessary.
Successful implementation of the relevant min. 5 projects must be evidenced by reference letters issued and signed by the clients confirming timely delivery and good quality of the services provided; self-declarations by the tenderers shall not be accepted.
Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required:
The tenderer shall prove its technical and professional capacity to perform the contract. This capacity will be evaluated using the following criteria:
a) sufficient internal capacity in terms of qualified human resources, whose number must be a minimum such as described in the technical proposal document for the given lot (attached to the relevant terms of reference) and qualifications and experience must correspond to the requirements of staff profiles (Annex XI);
b) professional experience in the domain of the tender lot of a minimum of 3 years;
c) at least 5 projects for the implementation and maintenance of ICT networks and audio/video systems at the value of a minimum of 200 000 EUR each, successfully completed in the last 3 years (i.e. since November 2011). Successful implementation of these projects must be evidenced by reference letters issued and signed by the clients confirming timely delivery and good quality of the services provided; self-declarations by the tenderers shall not be accepted.
Official partnership with the manufacturer of the offered devices is required to be established and evidenced.
III.2.4)Information about reserved contracts
III.3)Conditions specific to services contracts
III.3.1)Information about a particular profession
Execution of the service is reserved to a particular profession: no
III.3.2)Staff responsible for the execution of the service
Legal persons should indicate the names and professional qualifications of the staff responsible for the execution of the service: no

European institution/agency or international organisation
I.3)Main activity

The contracting authority is purchasing on behalf of other contracting authorities: no

Section II: Object of the contract
II.1)Description
II.1.1)Title attributed to the contract by the contracting authority:
Provision of interpretation services.
II.1.2)Type of contract and location of works, place of delivery or of performance
Services
Service category No 27: Other services
Main site or location of works, place of delivery or of performance: Frontex's office, Warsaw, Poland.

NUTS code PL127 Miasto Warszawa
II.1.3)Information about a public contract, a framework agreement or a dynamic purchasing system (DPS)
The notice involves the establishment of a framework agreement
II.1.4)Information on framework agreement
Framework agreement with a single operator

Duration of the framework agreement
Duration in years: 4

Estimated total value of purchases for the entire duration of the framework agreement
Estimated value excluding VAT:
Range: between 250 000 and 500 000 EUR
II.1.5)Short description of the contract or purchase(s)
The subject of this framework contract is the provision of highly professional services in the field of simultaneous and consecutive interpretation during various meetings and conferences organised by Frontex in Warsaw or its close vicinity. It will mainly concern Frontex Management Board meetings (high-level) held in Warsaw, however, Frontex might request interpretation services for other events of lower importance in Warsaw and its surrounding areas. The future framework contract shall include rental of the necessary equipment related to the interpretation service.
II.1.6)Common procurement vocabulary (CPV)

79540000 Interpretation services
II.1.7)Information about Government Procurement Agreement (GPA)
The contract is covered by the Government Procurement Agreement (GPA): no
II.1.8)Lots
This contract is divided into lots: no
II.1.9)Information about variants
Variants will be accepted: no
II.2)Quantity or scope of the contract
II.2.1)Total quantity or scope:
The contract will be concluded for 2 years with a possibility of 1 or 2 1-year extensions for a total period not exceeding 48 months.
The foreseen number of conferences/meetings to be held within the period of 2 years is maximum 20.
The conferences are usually 1 or 2-day conferences.
The contractor shall be capable of ensuring professional simultaneous and consecutive interpretation from and into all EU official languages: Bulgarian, Spanish, Czech, Danish, German, Estonian, Greek, English, French, Irish, Croatian, Italian, Latvian, Lithuanian, Hungarian, Maltese, Dutch, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Slovak, Slovenian, Finnish and Swedish. In addition, the same services shall be provided in Arabic, Russian and Turkish.
Estimated value excluding VAT:
Range: between 250 000 and 500 000 EUR
II.2.2)Information about options
Options: no
II.2.3)Information about renewals
This contract is subject to renewal: yes
Number of possible renewals: Range: between 1 and 2
In the case of renewable supplies or service contracts, estimated timeframe for subsequent contracts:
in months: 24 (from the award of the contract)
II.3)Duration of the contract or time limit for completion
Duration in months: 48 (from the award of the contract)

Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information
III.1)Conditions relating to the contract
III.1.1)Deposits and guarantees required:
No deposits or guarantees are required.
III.1.2)Main financing conditions and payment arrangements and/or reference to the relevant provisions governing them:
Payments shall be executed only if the contractor has fulfilled all his contractual obligations by the date on which the invoice is submitted.
The relevant payments will be done in 30 days from the receipt of the invoice.
III.1.3)Legal form to be taken by the group of economic operators to whom the contract is to be awarded:
No special legal form is required but, in the event a group of contractors submits an acceptable offer, it shall be necessary to provide an undertaking that each company shall be jointly and severally responsible for the due performance of the contract. In the case of a consortium bid, the contractor shall be required to act on behalf of the consortium.
III.1.4)Other particular conditions
The performance of the contract is subject to particular conditions: no
III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: The tenderer shall declare by means of Annex IV that none of the exclusion criteria apply.
The tenderer shall provide evidence that it is already established as a recognised legal entity and is registered in a relevant professional or trade register.
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: The tenderer shall provide evidence of its economic and financial capacity to perform the contract as follows:
— the tenderer should provide a declaration of the total turnover and the turnover on the services specified in the contract carried out over the past 3 financial years.
Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required: — the tenderer should provide a declaration of the total turnover and the turnover on the services specified in the contract carried out over the past 3 financial years. The total annual turnover shall be at least (equivalent of) 300 000 EUR for each year: 2013 and 2014.
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
The tenderer shall provide evidence of its technical and professional capacity to perform the contract as follows:
a) the tenderer should be established as a recognised legal entity and be registered in a relevant professional or trade register. The proof of establishment/registration indicating the authorisation to perform the services to be contracted must be provided;
b) the tenderer must have proven experience and expertise as well as HR capacity as provider of interpretation services for a minimum of 2 years, which shall be evidenced by:
— a brief description of the company's profile,
— description of the experience in the provision of interpretation services at high-level meetings, preferably in an international environment.
The following minimum company experience is required: organisation of at least 8 events that entailed simultaneous interpretation in at least 3 European languages for at least 30 participants in the last 3 years. This should be supported by at least 5 reference letters issued by former clients stating the type of event, number of participants, languages concerned and confirming the good quality of the services provided,
— a tenderer's statement of the tenderer's capacity regarding interpreters (how many potential candidates the contractor currently has available in relation to each of the required languages),
— at least 2 CVs of interpreters fulfilling the requirements of the profile as described in point II.11 of the tender specifications per each of the required languages, accompanied by their signed statements of intent,
— the tenderer must confirm availability of the technical equipment needed for simultaneous interpretation. In case of rental, it must be confirmed by a statement from a company from which the equipment will be rented.
Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required:
The tenderer must have proven experience and expertise as well as HR capacity as provider of interpretation services for a minimum of 2 years.
The following minimum company experience is required: organisation of at least 8 events that entailed simultaneous interpretation in at least 3 European languages for at least 30 participants in the last 3 years. This should be supported by at least 5 reference letters issued by former clients stating the type of event, number of participants, languages concerned and confirming good quality of the services provided,
— at least 2 CVs of interpreters fulfilling the requirements of the profile as described in point II.11 of the tender specifications per each of the required languages, accompanied by their signed statements of intent.
III.2.4)Information about reserved contracts
III.3)Conditions specific to services contracts

Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information
III.1)Conditions relating to the contract
III.1.1)Deposits and guarantees required:
III.1.2)Main financing conditions and payment arrangements and/or reference to the relevant provisions governing them:
III.1.3)Legal form to be taken by the group of economic operators to whom the contract is to be awarded:
III.1.4)Other particular conditions
The performance of the contract is subject to particular conditions: no
III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: The tenderer shall provide evidence that it is authorised to perform the contract under national law by provision of evidence that the tenderer is already established as a recognised legal entity and is registered in a relevant professional or trade register.
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: The Tenderer shall provide evidence of its sufficient economic and financial capacity to guarantee continuous and satisfactory performance throughout the envisaged lifetime of the contract as follows:
a) the tenderer shall provide Frontex with its profit and loss accounts and balance sheets for the past 3 financial years for which accounts have been closed, on condition that the publication of profit and loss accounts and balance sheets is stipulated by the legislation on firms in the country where the tenderer is established;
b) the tenderer shall provide Frontex with a declaration of the company's total turnover for the past 3 years for which accounts have been closed (information shall be provided separately for each year); the average turnover over the last 3 years must be greater than 500 000 EUR;
c) the tenderer shall provide a recent (issued within the last 3 months) statement from the tenderer's bank indicating good general financial viability of said company and its ability to access a credit line in the amount of at least of 50 000 EUR (or equivalent in local currency).
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
The tenderer shall provide evidence of its technical and professional capacity to perform the contract as follows:
A. the tenderer must have at least 3 years of professional experience in providing similar services, i.e. managing conferences and events.
Evidence of that must be provided by:
— provision of the company's portfolio confirming the tenderer's experience,
— provision of a list of contracts performed during the last 3 years which correspond to the services required within this call for tenders, indicating their customers, financial volume, scope and complexity,
— provision of at least 4 reference letters from the customers specified above confirming good quality of the services provided, self-declarations by the tenderers shall not be accepted;
B. the tenderer must prove and demonstrate its relevant personnel capacity and technical ability to provide all the services required under the prospective contract.
The following documents and/or information shall be presented as evidence of compliance with the technical and professional capacity criteria listed above:
— short overview on the company's technical and human resources confirming the tenderer's capacity to perform the contract,

Directive 2004/18/EC

1) Justification for the choice of the negotiated procedure without prior publication of a contract notice in the OJEU in accordance with Directive 2004/18/EC
No tenders or no suitable tenders in response to: open procedure

The tendering procedure was repeated under negotiated procedure regulated in RAP Article 135 point 1(a) in reference to Article 135 point 2 (negotiated procedure without prior publication of a contract notice with all the tenderers and only the tenderers satisfying the selection criteria who, during the previous procedure, submitted tenders in accordance with the formal requirements of the procurement procedure).

Framework contract for aerial surveillance services assets and expert support.
II.1.2)Type of contract and location of works, place of delivery or of performance
Services
Service category No 23: Investigation and security services, except armoured car services
Main site or location of works, place of delivery or of performance: EU external borders.
NUTS code

The notice involves the establishment of a framework agreement
II.1.4)Information on framework agreement
Framework agreement with several operators
maximum number of participants to the framework agreement envisaged: 10

Duration of the framework agreement
Duration in months: 48

Estimated total value of purchases for the entire duration of the framework agreement
Estimated value excluding VAT: 10 000 000 EUR
II.1.5)Short description of the contract or purchase(s)
The objective of this tender is to develop Frontex's technical equipment pool with the category of aerial surveillance equipment having a high level of deployability and availability and thus enabling Frontex to enhance its surveillance operational capability in areas of the EU external border.
In lot 1, the contractor shall provide Frontex with maritime surveillance flights over a pre-defined area of the EU external maritime border, within a specific time-frame, reporting defined objects and events of interest to a coordination centre designated by Frontex.
In lot 2, the contractor shall provide Frontex with land surveillance flights over a pre-defined area of the EU external land border, within a specific time-frame, reporting defined objects and events of interest to a coordination centre designated by Frontex.

III.1)Conditions relating to the contract

III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: A tenderer is asked to prove that it is authorised to perform the contract under its national law. Therefore, the tenderer shall provide as evidence the inclusion in a trade or professional register, or membership of a specific organisation, as well as valid certification/registration of the offered assets.
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: — The tenderer must prove its financial capacity for the past 3 financial years: 2012, 2013, 2014. Evidence must be provided by submission of relevant balance sheets (provided that the publication of balance sheets is stipulated by the legislation on firms in the country where the tenderer is established).
— The tenderer must be registered in a relevant commercial or trade register. Evidence must be provided by submission of a certificate of professional or commercial registration imposed by the country in which the tenderer is established. If the tenderer is not required or permitted to enrol in such a register for reasons of his statute or legal status, an explanation should be provided.
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
The tenderer's technical and professional capacity will be evaluated using the following criteria:
— the tenderer must have at least 3 years' experience in providing similar equipment/services,
— the tenderer must be able to provide a team of experts matching the requirements specified in the terms of reference,
— the tenderer must demonstrate its technical ability to provide all the services and products required in this call for tenders.
The following documents or information shall be presented as evidence of compliance with the technical and professional capacity criteria:
— evidence of experience must be provided by submission of a list of contracts performed or deliveries executed in the years 2012, 2013 and 2014, indicating sums, dates and recipients. The proper performance of the contracts listed shall be documented in a form of a reference letter issued and signed by an authorised person of the particular tenderer's client. At least 2 such reference letters are required to be submitted in the offer,
— evidence of team capacity must be provided by submitting CVs of the proposed personnel,
— evidence of technical ability must be provided by submission of a detailed description of the technical equipment and material available to the tenderer for the provision of the services and products required by this call for tenders. This description should include platforms, payload combinations, communication options, and mission support capabilities.

III.1.3)Legal form to be taken by the group of economic operators to whom the contract is to be awarded:
No special legal form is required but, in the event a group of contractors submits an acceptable offer, it shall be necessary to provide an undertaking that each company shall be jointly and severally responsible for the due performance of the contract. III.2.2)Economic and financial ability

— the tenderer should provide a declaration of the total turnover and the turnover on the services specified in the contract carried out over the past 3 financial years.

III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
The tenderer shall provide evidence of its technical and professional capacity to perform the contract as follows:
a) the tenderer should be established as a recognised legal entity and be registered in a relevant professional or trade register. Proof of establishment/registration indicating authorisation to perform the services to be contracted must be provided;
b) the tenderer must have proven experience and expertise as well as HR capacity as provider of handymen or similar (e.g. maintenance, repairs, etc.) services for a minimum of 2 years, which shall be evidenced by:
— a brief description of the company's profile,
— scope of services provided,
— list of relevant equipment,
— CVs of the 2 dedicated handymen proposed for these services including all relevant information, such as experience, level of English and competences,
— indication of the car available for the disposal of bulky trash,
— description of experience in the market,
— information about similar contracts, supported by at least 3 reference letters issued in the name of the contractor or related to the proposed individuals, from clients for whom similar services have been provided in the last 3 years.
Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required:
2 years of documented experience in similar services.
At least 3 reference letters issued in the name of the contractor or related to the proposed individuals from clients for whom similar services have been provided in the last 3 years.

Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information
III.1)Conditions relating to the contract
III.1.1)Deposits and guarantees required:
III.1.2)Main financing conditions and payment arrangements and/or reference to the relevant provisions governing them:
III.1.3)Legal form to be taken by the group of economic operators to whom the contract is to be awarded:
III.1.4)Other particular conditions
The performance of the contract is subject to particular conditions: no
III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: Lots 1 and 2: legal capacity:
the tenderer must be established as a recognised legal entity and be registered in a relevant professional or trade register. It has to be authorised to perform the prospective contract under the national law of the country it is established (or, in case of consortium, under the national law of the country of the consortium leader). Evidence of that must be provided by submission of a certificate of professional or commercial registration or a certificate of membership of a specific organisation (imposed by the country in which the tenderer is established). If the tenderer is not required or permitted to enrol in such a register for reasons of his statute or legal status, an explanation should be provided.
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: Lots 1 and 2:
a) the tenderer's balance sheets for the past 2 financial years, provided that the publication of balance sheets is stipulated by the legislation on firms in the country where the tenderer is established;
b) the tenderer shall provide a declaration of the total turnover and the turnover on the services specified in the contract carried out over the past 3 years. The turnovers must indicate a substantial amount of similar business contracted in previous years by the tenderer.
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
Lots 1 and 2:
a) a brief description of the tenderer's economic activity related to the lot(s) applied for, providing with the list of contracts performed in the past 3 years, with sums, dates and recipients. The Tenderer must have experience in providing similar services. Evidence of that must be provided by submission of at least 2 reference letters issued and signed by an authorised person of a particular tenderer's client, regarding concluded and completed (in the period from the year 2010 to 2014) contracts above the value of 100 000 EUR. Required reference letters should contain a brief description of each of the referenced projects;
b) the tenderer shall confirm possession of the necessary hardware and software for performance of the prospective assignment. Evidence of that must be provided by submission of a free-format self-statement;
c) the tenderer must prove its relevant personnel capacity to fulfil the tasks required under the prospective contract. Evidence of that must be provided by submission of a presentation of the team of experts who will conduct the work (with a clear description of the roles and responsibilities of each of them) and of the self-statement provided by the authorised person indicating the availability of the team. All the proposed experts must have a working knowledge of English.
III.2.4)Information about reserved contracts

Justification for the award of the contract without prior publication of a contract notice in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU):
Directive 2004/18/EC

1) Justification for the choice of the negotiated procedure without prior publication of a contract notice in the OJEU in accordance with Directive 2004/18/EC
The works/goods/services can be provided only by a particular tenderer for reasons that are:
technical,
connected with the protection of exclusive rights
Software extensively used already by Frontex for statistical data processing and analysis as well as for visualisation of various types. Software licences are a type of subscription and they are valid for a specific period of time. In this case, the purchase can only be made from a specific local vendor nominated by the producer and having the sole and exclusive right to grant licences to the entities located in Poland.

Poland-Warsaw: Frontex positioning system

2014/S 234-411329

Contract award notice

Services
Directive 2004/18/EC

Section I: Contracting authority
I.1)Name, addresses and contact point(s)

Official name: Frontex
Postal address: Rondo ONZ 1
Town: Warsaw
Postal code: 00-124
Country: Poland
For the attention of: Procurement Unit
E-mail: procurement@frontex.europa.eu
Telephone: +48 222059500
Fax: +48 222059501

Internet address(es):

General address of the contracting authority: http://www.frontex.europa.eu
I.2)Type of the contracting authority
European institution/agency or international organisation
I.3)Main activity
I.4)Contract award on behalf of other contracting authorities
The contracting authority is purchasing on behalf of other contracting authorities: no

Section II: Object of the contract
II.1)Description
II.1.1)Title attributed to the contract
Frontex positioning system.
II.1.2)Type of contract and location of works, place of delivery or of performance
Services
Service category No 27: Other services
Main site or location of works, place of delivery or of performance: Frontex HQ, Warsaw, Poland.

NUTS code PL127 Miasto Warszawa
II.1.3)Information about a framework agreement or a dynamic purchasing system (DPS)
II.1.4)Short description of the contract or purchase(s)
Frontex positioning system (FPS) concept aims to create a single, integrated, real-time automated system for tracking assets deployed in the joint operations (JOs), and displaying positions of the assets in real time as well as calculating running costs of those assets, thus providing for automated procedures for assimilating and reporting financial data within JOs.
The aim of Frontex and the objective of this contract are to maintain and provide existing functionalities of the FPS for JOs improved and developed according to the requirements defined. The FPS shall offer the capability to:
1) display positions of the assets in real time;
2) automatically calculate costs of the assets (per asset and JO);
3) be integrated with at least 5 third party positioning systems.
II.1.5)Common procurement vocabulary (CPV)

72000000 IT services: consulting, software development, Internet and support
II.1.6)Information about Government Procurement Agreement (GPA)
The contract is covered by the Government Procurement Agreement (GPA): no
II.2)Total final value of contract(s)
II.2.1)Total final value of contract(s)
Value: 578 378,35 EUR
Excluding VAT

IV.1.1)Type of procedure

IV.2)Award criteria
IV.2.1)Award criteria

1. Technical value. Weighting 50
2. Financial value. Weighting 50
IV.2.2)Information about electronic auction
An electronic auction has been used: no

IV.3.1)File reference number attributed by the contracting authority

Section IV: Procedure
IV.1)Type of procedure
IV.1.1)Type of procedure
Negotiated without a call for competition
Justification for the award of the contract without prior publication of a contract notice in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU):
Directive 2004/18/EC

1) Justification for the choice of the negotiated procedure without prior publication of a contract notice in the OJEU in accordance with Directive 2004/18/EC
No tenders or no suitable tenders in response to: open procedure
All tenders submitted in reply to an open procedure, a restricted procedure or competitive dialogue were irregular or inacceptable. Only those tenderers were included in the negotiations which have satisfied the qualitative selection criteria.
The open procurement procedure Frontex/OP/484/2013 was unsuccessful as no acceptable offers were submitted in reply to the invitation to tender. Negotiated procedure without prior publication on the basis of Article 134.1(a) of the rules of application (Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) No 1268/2012 of 29.10.2012 on the rules of application of Regulation (EU, Euratom) No 966/2012 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the financial rules applicable to the general budget of the Union) was launched. The total value of the specific contracts to be signed under the framework agreement shall exceed the value of the Directive thresholds. The framework contract financial ceiling has been set at 1 000 000 EUR.
IV.2)Award criteria
IV.2.1)Award criteria
The most economically advantageous tender in terms of
1. Technical merit of the proposal. Weighting 60
2. Price. Weighting 40
IV.2.2)Information about electronic auction
An electronic auction has been used: no

IV.3.1)File reference number attributed by the contracting authority

Framework agreement with several operators
maximum number of participants to the framework agreement envisaged: 5

Duration of the framework agreement
Duration in years: 4
II.1.5)Short description of the contract or purchase(s)
Provision of a broad range of conference and event organisation services to Frontex. The scope of the tender is divided into 2 lots.
Lot 1 — organisation of events up to 100 participants — the contractors will be responsible for providing a venue and other conference-related services for up to 100 participants.
Lot 2 — organisation of complex events — the contractor will be responsible for arrangement of services related to the functioning and organisation of complex events with a number of participants exceeding 100.
II.1.6)Common procurement vocabulary (CPV)

55120000 Hotel meeting and conference services

Information about lots

1)Short description

Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information
III.1)Conditions relating to the contract
III.1.1)Deposits and guarantees required:
III.1.2)Main financing conditions and payment arrangements and/or reference to the relevant provisions governing them:
III.1.3)Legal form to be taken by the group of economic operators to whom the contract is to be awarded:
III.1.4)Other particular conditions
III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: The tenderer shall provide evidence that it is authorised to perform the contract under the national law by provision of evidence that the tenderer is already established as a recognised legal entity and is registered in a relevant professional or trade register.
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: a) The tenderer shall provide Frontex with its profit and loss accounts and balance sheets for the past 3 financial years for which accounts have been closed, on condition that the publication of profit and loss account and balance sheets is stipulated by the legislation on firms in the country where the tenderer is established; in cases when a company was created less than 3 years ago, it is obliged to deliver financial evidence only for the period of existence.
b) The tenderer shall provide Frontex with a declaration of the company's total turnover from the past 3 years for which accounts have been closed (information shall be provided separately for each year); the average turnover over the last 3 years (or from the period of existence of a company if it was created less than 3 year ago) must be greater than 500 000 PLN when submitting an offer for lot 1 and 800 000 PLN when submitting an offer for lot 2.
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
For lot 1:
— the tenderer must have at least 3 years of professional experience in providing similar services, i.e. providing organisation of meetings and events; additionally, the tenderer must have experience in providing at least 4 such services for a minimum of 70 participants and at least 4 such services for a minimum of 100 participants in the last 3 years (in 2012, 2013 or 2014),
— the tenderer must prove and demonstrate its relevant personnel capacity and technical ability to provide all the services required under the prospective contract.
The following documents and/or information shall be presented as evidence of compliance with the technical and professional capacity criteria listed above:
— short overview on the company portfolio and human resources confirming the tenderer's professional experience,
— a presentation of the venues offered including floor plans, pictures, arrangement possibilities, outdoor area, parking facilities and the description of the catering services,
— a list and a brief description of activities in the field of providing organisation of meetings and events, together with the list of contracts performed in the past 3 years, with sums, dates, recipients and brief description of the project's activities,
— reference letters (related to the abovementioned list of contracts) issued and signed by the clients confirming satisfactory completion of the services (a minimum of 4 reference letters concerning contracts for organisation of meetings and events similar to the scope of the tender for a minimum of 70 persons and at least 4 reference letters regarding meetings and events similar to the scope of the tender for at least 100 participants; self-declarations by the tenderers shall not be accepted),
— a copy of valid civil liability insurance, concluded for the amount not lower than 500 000 PLN or equivalent, issued for the tenderer.
For lot 2:
— the tenderer must have at least 3 years of professional experience in providing similar services, i.e. delivering event planning services and managing events; additionally, the tenderer should have experience in providing at least 3 such services for a minimum of 150 participants and at least 3 such services for a minimum of 400 participants in the last 3 years (in 2012, 2013 or 2014),
— the tenderer must prove and demonstrate its relevant personnel capacity and technical ability to provide all the services required under the prospective contract.
The following documents and/or information shall be presented as evidence of compliance with the technical and professional capacity criteria listed above:
— short overview on the company portfolio and human resources confirming the tenderer's professional experience,
— a list and a brief description of recent activities in the field of event planning services and event management, together with the list of contracts performed in the past 3 years, with sums, dates, recipients and brief description of the project's activities,
— reference letters (related to the abovementioned list of contracts) issued and signed by the clients confirming satisfactory completion of the services (a minimum of 3 reference letters regarding contracts for event planning services for a minimum of 150 persons and at least 3 reference letters concerning events for event planning services for at least 400 participants; self-declarations by the tenderers shall not be accepted),
— curriculum vitae detailing the educational and professional qualifications of the event project manager. After the contract signature, the contractor will be asked to present a certificate of clean criminal record of the proposed event project manager,
— the list of names and the role of the staff designated for the implementation of the contract,
— a copy of valid civil liability insurance, concluded for the amount not lower than 1 000 000 PLN or equivalent, issued for the tenderer,
— a proposal of the hypothetical event.
III.2.4)Information about reserved contracts

III.3.1)Information about a particular profession
III.3.2)Staff responsible for the execution of the service

Framework agreement with several operators
maximum number of participants to the framework agreement envisaged: 3

Estimated total value of purchases for the entire duration of the framework agreement
Estimated value excluding VAT: 17 400 000 EUR
II.1.5)Short description of the contract or purchase(s)
The scope of the intended framework contracts with reopening of competition covers:
lot 1 — software development services; lot 2 — system, storage and helpdesk support services; lot 3 — ICT networks and audio/video systems.
II.1.6)Common procurement vocabulary (CPV)

72000000 IT services: consulting, software development, Internet and support
II.1.7)Information about Government Procurement Agreement (GPA)
The contract is covered by the Government Procurement Agreement (GPA): no
II.1.8)Lots
This contract is divided into lots: yes

II.1.9)Information about variants
Variants will be accepted: no
II.2)Quantity or scope of the contract
II.2.1)Total quantity or scope:
For lots 1 and 3 this framework contract duration is 2 years + 1 year + 1 year i.e. after the initial duration of 2 years the framework contract shall be automatically renewed no more than 2 times, each time for a period of 1 year and on the same conditions, unless one of the parties informs the other of its intention not to extend the framework contract and such notification is received by the party to which it is addressed, no later than 3 months before the contract expires. The overall duration of the framework contract may in no event exceed 4 years.
For lot 2 the duration of the framework contract is 4 years.
Frontex reserves the right to conduct an exceptional negotiated procedure based on Article 134.1(f) of Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) No 1268/2012 of 29.10.2012 (RAP) to increase the ceiling with the contractors of particular lot(s), if such a need occurs.
Estimated value excluding VAT:
Range: between 17 400 000 and 26 100 000 EUR
II.2.2)Information about options
Options: yes
Description of these options: After the initial contract duration of 2 years, the framework contracts for lots 1 and 3 shall be automatically renewed no more than 2 times, each time for a period of 1 year.
Frontex reserves the right to conduct an exceptional negotiated procedure based on Article 134.1(f) of Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) No 1268/2012 of 29.10.2012 (RAP) to increase the ceiling with the contractors of particular lot(s), if such a need occurs.
Provisional timetable for recourse to these options:
in months: 24 (from the award of the contract)
II.2.3)Information about renewals
This contract is subject to renewal: yes
Number of possible renewals: Range: between 1 and 2
II.3)Duration of the contract or time limit for completion
Duration in months: 48 (from the award of the contract)

Information about lots
Lot No: 1 Lot title: Software development services
1)Short description
Frontex is seeking long-term cooperation with 3 contractors who offer the best 'value for money' and can sustain readiness for these services throughout the duration of this FWC.
The objective of lot 1 of the framework contract is to provide Frontex with a professional capability for developing software solutions and maintaining current software solutions supporting Frontex operational and administrative areas.
2)Common procurement vocabulary (CPV)

72000000 IT services: consulting, software development, Internet and support
3)Quantity or scope
Estimated value excluding VAT: 7 550 000 EUR
4)Indication about different date for duration of contract or starting/completion
5)Additional information about lots
Lot 1 software development services shall be considered as a source for contracting software development services under T&M, QT&M or fixed price assignments. Software development services shall be understood in broad meaning with reference to all phases of a software life cycle and technical domains of software engineering. Therefore it may cover typical software development as well as maintenance of existing software, refactoring, tuning, etc. The technological scope of the services covers technologies presented in the Annex 'Current ICT baseline'.
Lot No: 2 Lot title: System, storage and helpdesk support services
1)Short description
Frontex is seeking long-term cooperation with 3 contractors who offer the best 'value for money' and who are fully capable of provisioning intramural time and means services for ICT helpdesk and ICT systems and storage administration in order to support current ICT internal staff in providing maintenance services to Frontex business units under the agreed service levels. In addition to that, the contract may be used for building new capabilities (systems and processes) under quoted time and means as well as specific, fixed-price contracts.
2)Common procurement vocabulary (CPV)

72000000 IT services: consulting, software development, Internet and support
3)Quantity or scope
Estimated value excluding VAT: 5 700 000 EUR
4)Indication about different date for duration of contract or starting/completion
5)Additional information about lots
Lot 2 is considered by Frontex as a primary source of external services in support of the Frontex ICT service centre and service management team and the Frontex ICT servers and storage team in their routine tasks. The lot may also be used for delivering quoted time and means as well as fixed-price solutions such as systems upgrades and new systems management solutions.
Lot No: 3 Lot title: ICT networks and audio/video systems
1)Short description
Frontex is seeking long-term cooperation with 3 contractors who offer the best 'value for money' and who are fully capable of provisioning intramural services for the ICT network team in order to support the current ICT internal staff in providing maintenance services to Frontex business units under the agreed service levels, support the current IP network infrastructure (software and hardware), implement changes to the current networks and capability for delivering related products offered in the official price list that includes all the current hardware devices, but also their respective updated/upgraded versions.
2)Common procurement vocabulary (CPV)

72000000 IT services: consulting, software development, Internet and support
3)Quantity or scope
Estimated value excluding VAT: 4 200 000 EUR
4)Indication about different date for duration of contract or starting/completion
5)Additional information about lots
Lot 3 is considered by Frontex as a primary source for maintenance of the current and future IP network infrastructure, and a source for new IP network-related hardware and the external services in support of the Frontex ICT network team in their routine tasks.

Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information
III.1)Conditions relating to the contract
III.1.1)Deposits and guarantees required:
No deposits or guarantees are required.
III.1.2)Main financing conditions and payment arrangements and/or reference to the relevant provisions governing them:
Payments shall be executed only if the contractor has fulfilled all his contractual obligations by the date on which the invoice is submitted.
The relevant payments will be completed 30 days from the receipt of the invoice.
III.1.3)Legal form to be taken by the group of economic operators to whom the contract is to be awarded:
No special legal form is required, but in the event that a group of contractors submits an acceptable offer, it shall be necessary to provide an undertaking that each company shall be jointly and severally responsible for the due performance of the contract. In the case of a consortium bid, the contractor shall be required to act on behalf of the consortium.
III.1.4)Other particular conditions
The performance of the contract is subject to particular conditions: no
III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: The tenderer shall declare by means of Annex V that none of the exclusion criteria apply.
The tenderer shall provide evidence that it is already established as a recognised legal entity and is registered in a relevant professional or trade register.
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: The tenderer shall provide evidence of its economic and financial capacity to perform the contract as follows:
a) the tenderer shall provide Frontex with its balance sheets for the past 3 financial years, on the condition that the publication of balance sheets is stipulated by the legislation on firms in the country where the tenderer is established;
b) the tenderer shall provide Frontex with a declaration of the total turnover carried out over the past 3 years.
Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required: The 3-year sum of the tenderer's total turnover must amount to a minimum of:
for lot 1: (equivalent of) 2 500 000 EUR;
for lot 2: (equivalent of) 2 000 000 EUR;
for lot 3: (equivalent of) 500 000 EUR.
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
The following documents or/and information shall be presented as evidence of compliance with the technical and professional capacity criteria listed above:
a) the tenderer must be able to provide a team of consultants matching the requirements detailed in the relevant terms of reference document and its attachments. This must be done by means of completed personnel capacity declaration for lots 1 and 3 and by submitting forms for the named personnel available for the FWC for lot 2;
b) a list and a brief description of recent activities (in the last 3 years) in the field of the relevant lot, together with the list of contracts performed in the past 3 years, with sums, dates and recipients;
c) the tenderer shall supply descriptions/presentations of the projects, as described above.
Each description shall include at least the following information:
— details of the client (name, address, contact details),
— number of users,
— functionalities,
— high-level description of the solution architecture,
— budget involved,
— any other relevant information considered necessary.
Successful implementation of these projects must be evidenced by reference letters issued and signed by the clients confirming timely delivery and good quality of the services provided; self-declarations by the tenderers shall not be accepted.
Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required:
The tenderer shall prove its technical and professional capacity to perform the contract. This capacity will be evaluated using the following criteria:
a) sufficient internal capacity in terms of qualified human resources, whose number must be minimum such as described in the technical proposal document for the given lot (attached to the relevant terms of reference) and qualifications and experience must correspond to the requirements of staff profiles (Annex XI);
b) professional experience in the domain of the tender lot of a minimum of 3 years;
c) for lot 1:
at least 5 projects for the development of Bespoke Web-based software in .NET technology completed within the last 3 years (i.e. since November 2011), which have been accepted/approved by the clients, and which had a minimum value of 150 000 EUR each;
for lot 2:
at least 3 projects for the provision of services as described in the lot which have been successfully completed in the last 3 years (i.e. since November 2011) at the value of 1 500 000 EUR in total for all presented contracts. At least 2 of these projects shall cover ICT systems and storage administration and at least 2 ICT helpdesk services, both implemented at the clients' premises;
for lot 3:
at least 5 projects for the implementation and maintenance of ICT networks and audio/video systems at the value of a minimum of 200 000 EUR each, successfully completed in the last 3 years (i.e. since November 2011). Official partnership with the manufacturer of the offered devices is required to be established and evidenced.
III.2.4)Information about reserved contracts
III.3)Conditions specific to services contracts

III.3.2)Staff responsible for the execution of the service

III.1.4)Other particular conditions
III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: Lot 1, 2, 3, 4 — the evidence that the tenderer is already established as a recognised legal entity and is registered in a relevant professional or trade register.
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: Lot 1, 2, 3, 4 — the tenderer shall provide Frontex with its profit and loss accounts and balance sheets for the past 3 financial years for which accounts have been closed, on condition that the publication of profit and loss account and balance sheets is stipulated by the legislation on firms in the country where the tenderer is established; in cases when a company was created less than 3 years ago, it is obliged to deliver financial evidence only for the period of existence.
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
Lot 1: a) the tenderer shall have the experience in organising at least 3 similar events for a minimum of 400 participants in the last 2 years (in 2013 or 2014), or when the company was established less than a year ago, the owner of the company should possess the required experience; b) a list of at least 3 abovementioned events which were successfully completed together with reference letters confirming proper execution of the services; the list should state the following information: dates, recipients and brief description of the project's activities; c) presentation of the venue (floor plans, pictures, arrangement possibilities, catering area, outdoor area, parking facilities, information about the Internet availability and security services); d) menu proposal for coffee break and lunch and a description of the organisation of permanent coffee stations.
Lot 2: a) a list of at least 3 similar events for which the tenderer provided technical equipment and assistance (and at least in one of them provided live streaming services) in the last 3 years (in 2012, 2013 or 2014) with a minimum of 400 participants. The list should state the following: dates, recipients and brief description of the project's activities; b) at least 3 reference letters from clients confirming proper execution of the above listed services; c) detailed description of the equipment to be used.
Lot 3: a) a list of at least 3 similar events organised in the last 3 years (in 2012, 2013 or 2014) with a minimum of 300 participants. The list should state the following: dates, recipients and brief description of the project's activities; b) at least 3 reference letters from clients confirming proper execution of the above listed services; c) presentation of the venue (floor plans, pictures, arrangement possibilities, outdoor area, parking facilities); d) proposal of the menu (food and drinks).

Lot 4: a) a list of projects implemented in the last 3 years (in 2012, 2013 or 2014), which included the preparation of the exhibition areas, similar in scale and scope to the tender in question. The list should state the following: dates, recipients and brief description of the project's activities; b) at least 3 reference letters from clients confirming proper execution of the above listed services; c) proposed design (visualisation) of a Member State authority stand (for 1 authority) in accordance with the ED4BG visual identity and inclusive of the ED4BG logo, country name and flag (or an alternative solution indicating the country) together with the coat of arms. For this visualisation, Poland should be used as an example — Polish coat of arms in Annex X. Visualisation should be accompanied by a short description of the proposed materials and equipment to be used; d) proposed design (visualisation) of EU agencies' exhibition in accordance with the ED4BG visual identity and incorporating the EU agency names and logos. The visualisation should be made for the area where 15 organisations will be allocated as indicated in the technical specifications (point 6.3.b). 12 logos and names can be found on Frontex's website: http://frontex.europa.eu/partners/eu-partners/eu-agencies/ Visualisation should be accompanied by a short description of the proposed materials and equipment to be used; e) proposed design (visualisation) of the stage design in the main conference room with a short description of the materials to be used (as described in the technical specifications, point 6.1.); f) proposed design/solution (visualisation) for the photo exhibition and short description of the concept.

Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information
III.1)Conditions relating to the contract
III.1.1)Deposits and guarantees required:
III.1.2)Main financing conditions and payment arrangements and/or reference to the relevant provisions governing them:
III.1.3)Legal form to be taken by the group of economic operators to whom the contract is to be awarded:
III.1.4)Other particular conditions
III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: A certificate of professional or commercial registration imposed by the country in which the tenderer is established (in Poland: KRS) must be presented. If the tenderer is not required or permitted to enrol in such a register for reasons of his statute or legal status, an explanation should be provided.
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: a) the tenderer shall provide Frontex with its profit and loss accounts and balance sheets for the past 3 financial years for which accounts have been closed, on condition that the publication of profit and loss account and balance sheets is stipulated by the legislation on firms in the country where the tenderer is established; in cases when a company was created less than 3 years ago it is obliged to deliver financial evidence only for the period of existence;
b) the tenderer shall provide Frontex with a declaration of the company's total turnover for the past 3 years for which accounts have been closed (information shall be provided separately for each year); the average turnover over the last 3 years (or for the period of existence of a company if it was created less than 3 years ago) must be greater than 160 000 EUR.
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
1. Tenderer's brochure or indicated website reference clearly proving that the tenderer is a company specialised in communication, graphic design, publishing house, DTP services provider, advertising (these categories do not exclude each other), operating at least 2 years in the above listed market categories.
2. Company's generic portfolio displaying works of at least the last 2 years, in order to asses the overall scope and diversity of realised works for different media (maximum 10 pieces).
3. Company's publications portfolio:
The tenderer assessment will cover graphic design competence. The tenderer should present the following:
— 3 published print publications (books, magazines or brochures of not less than 12 pages, including covers) that were layouted by the tenderer,
— 3 print products that were designed and layouted by the tenderer,
— optionally: examples of interactive publications which will be considered an advantageous asset (up to 3 examples),
— optionally: up to 3 print products that were designed by the tenderer's employed staff assigned to this contract.
Important: each piece of the portfolio must demonstrate works of the employed staff to be assigned to this contract (point 6 of this table). Please clearly state the names and roles of professionals who worked in each project, and define the tasks which were outsourced to third parties (if any).
4. Reference letters (including description of projects and contact details) of at least 5 clients for whom the tenderer provided DTP and/or design projects in the past 2 years.
5. The curriculum vitae of the proposed account/project manager confirming the following requirement:
— experience in project management of design and desktop publishing projects (required minimum 5 years of experience). Please state the clients for which the work was realised, types and scale of projects realised.

The submitted curriculum vitae should use the Europass template (http://europass.cedefop.europa.eu/en/documents/curriculum-vitae/templates-instructions).
6. The curricula vitae of:
a) at least 1 senior art director or senior graphic designer who is a full-time employee and who will supervise all assignments on the implementation of the prospective contract (10 years of experience in publishing design, art directing, graphic design, brand identity, corporate visual identity and related projects);
b) at least 1 graphic designer/DTP layouter who is a full-time employee and will be assigned to this contract (required minimum 5 years of experience in the realisation of publications and magazines);
c) at least 1 DTP layouter/prepress operator who is a full-time employee and will be assigned to this contract (required minimum 5 years of experience in layouting and technical preparation of publications and magazines for print);
d) any other professionals the tenderer is considering involving in the prospective work.

The submitted curricula vitae should use the Europass template (http://europass.cedefop.europa.eu/en/documents/curriculum-vitae/templates-instructions).
7. The case study prepared on the basis of the template provided in Annex III.
