The relevant payments will be done in 30 days from the receipt of the invoice.
III.1.3)Legal form to be taken by the group of economic operators to whom the contract is to be awarded:
No special legal form is required but, in the event a group of contractors submits an acceptable offer, it shall be necessary to provide an undertaking that each company shall be jointly and severally responsible for the due performance of the contract. In the case of a consortium bid, the contractor shall be required to act on behalf of the consortium.
III.1.4)Other particular conditions
The performance of the contract is subject to particular conditions: no
III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: The tenderer shall declare by means of Annex IV that none of the exclusion criteria apply.
The tenderer shall provide evidence that it is already established as a recognised legal entity and is registered in a relevant professional or trade register.
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: The tenderer shall provide evidence of its economic and financial capacity to perform the contract as follows:
— the tenderer shall provide Frontex with its balance sheets for the past 3 financial years, on condition that the publication of balance sheets is stipulated by the legislation on firms in the country where the tenderer is established,
— the tenderer should provide a declaration of the total turnover and the turnover on the services specified in the contract carried out over the past 3 financial years.
Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required: The total annual turnover shall be at least (the equivalent of) 360 000 EUR for each year: 2011, 2012 and 2013.
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
The tenderer shall provide evidence of its technical and professional capacity to perform the contract as follows:
(a) the tenderer should be established as a recognised legal entity and be registered in a relevant professional or trade register. The proof of establishment/registration indicating the authorisation to perform the services to be contracted must be provided;
(b) the tenderer must have proven experience and expertise as well as HR capacity as an office cleaning services provider for a minimum of 3 years, which shall be evidenced by:
— a comprehensive description of company profile,
— staffing chart or equivalent,
— the list of companies to whom office cleaning services were provided in the last 3 years with contact details for references,
—at least 4 reference letters confirming good quality of the office cleaning services provided in the years 2011–2013,
— description of the cleaning equipment at the disposal of the tenderer.
Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required:
3 years of documented experience in office cleaning services.
At least 4 reference letters issued by institutional clients, confirming good quality of the office cleaning services provided in the years 2011–2013 on a significant surface.
III.2.4)Information about reserved contracts
III.3)Conditions specific to services contracts
III.3.1)Information about a particular profession
Execution of the service is reserved to a particular profession: no
III.3.2)Staff responsible for the execution of the service
Legal persons should indicate the names and professional qualifications of the staff responsible for the execution of the service: no

b) a list and a brief description of recent activities in the field of office supplies, together with the list of contracts above the value of 10 000 EUR or equivalent, performed in the past 3 years, with sums, dates and recipients (public and/or private);
c) reference letters (related to the abovementioned list of contracts above the value of 10 000 EUR or equivalent) issued and signed by the clients confirming timely delivery and good quality of the services performed; self-declarations by the tenderers shall not be accepted.

Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information
III.1)Conditions relating to the contract
III.1.1)Deposits and guarantees required:
III.1.2)Main financing conditions and payment arrangements and/or reference to the relevant provisions governing them:
III.1.3)Legal form to be taken by the group of economic operators to whom the contract is to be awarded:
III.1.4)Other particular conditions
III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: Tenderers are asked to prove that they are authorised to perform the contract under the national law as evidenced by inclusion in a trade or professional register, or a sworn declaration or certificate, membership of a specific organisation.
Evidence required:
— a certificate of professional or commercial registration imposed by the country in which the tenderer is established. If the tenderer is not required or permitted to enrol in such a register for reasons of his statute or legal status, an explanation should be provided.
Tenderers shall also provide a duly filled in and signed legal entity form (Annex VI) accompanied by the documents requested therein.
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: Each tenderer shall provide evidence of its economic and financial capacity to perform the contract as follows:
a) the tenderer shall provide Frontex with its balance sheets for the past 3 financial years, on condition that the publication of balance sheets is stipulated by the legislation on firms in the country where the tenderer is established;
b) the tenderer shall provide a declaration of the total turnover carried out over the past 3 years: 2011, 2012 and 2013;
This total turnover for the last 3 years in total shall be at least (equivalent of):
lot 1 — 800 000 EUR or equivalent;
lot 2 — 400 000 EUR or equivalent;
lot 3 — 30 000 EUR or equivalent;
lot 4 — 120 000 EUR or equivalent;
lot 5 — 280 000 EUR or equivalent;
c) the tenderer shall provide a copy of valid civil liability insurance issued for the tenderer, concluded for the amount not lower than:
lot 1 — 200 000 EUR or equivalent;
lot 2 — 100 000 EUR or equivalent;
lot 3 — 10 000 EUR or equivalent;
lot 4 — 60 000 EUR or equivalent;
lot 5 — 70 000 EUR or equivalent.
The obligation of a tenderer to submit the documentary evidence referred to in this point is waived for a particular year if such evidence has already been submitted to Frontex for that year for the purposes of another procurement procedure and still complies with the requirements of this point. The tenderer is in such cases obliged to indicate the reference number of that procurement procedure.
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
The tenderer shall provide, for each lot separately, evidence of its technical and professional capacity to perform the contract as follows:
1. the tenderer must have at least 3 years' experience in providing similar services i.e. supply, installation and maintenance of furniture of a type corresponding to the specific lot;
2. the tenderer must prove and demonstrate its relevant personnel capacity and technical ability to provide all the services required under the prospective contract for the given lot.
The a.m. capacity shall be evidenced by presenting the following documents:
a) (company portfolio) a presentation of the company demonstrating stability, length of time in this business, overall size of the organisation and description of activities relating to services required in the specific lot;
b) a list and short description of at least 3 projects the tenderer has completed during the last 3 years, which are similar to the content and volumes of the services and supplies requested in the specific lot, and at least 3 of them confirmed by the reference letters indicating good quality of services and deliveries provided. For lot 3 a photo presentation of similar carpentry works (at least 3 to choose from), such as a conference table, built-in bar, shelf, bookcase and/or cabinets, catering/cocktail stands;
c) a presentation of staff resources that will be designated to perform the contract for the specific lot with a clear description of the roles and responsibilities of each of them and a division of tasks including the full curriculum vitae of the project manager.
Only the offers that meet the selection criteria shall pass to the second stage of the evaluation.
The obligation of a tenderer to submit the documentary evidence referred to in this point is waived for a particular year if such evidence has already been submitted to Frontex for that year for the purposes of another procurement procedure and still complies with the requirements of this point. The tenderer is however obliged to indicate the reference number of that procurement procedure.

Section II: Object of the contract
II.1)Description
II.1.1)Title attributed to the contract by the contracting authority:
Media/digital assets management system.
II.1.2)Type of contract and location of works, place of delivery or of performance
Services
Service category No 7: Computer and related services
Main site or location of works, place of delivery or of performance: Frontex HQ, Warsaw, Poland.

NUTS code PL127 Miasto Warszawa
II.1.3)Information about a public contract, a framework agreement or a dynamic purchasing system (DPS)
The notice involves a public contract
II.1.4)Information on framework agreement
II.1.5)Short description of the contract or purchase(s)
The M/DAM system is expected to be the central repository of all Frontex media assets, with rich metadata possibilities which will allow to make advanced search and annotate files depending on their status (e.g. uploaded but not published yet, work-in-progress file). The M/DAM system would allow the assignment of different access rights to different assets, as well as to activate/deactivate certain functionalities for selected user(s).
II.1.6)Common procurement vocabulary (CPV)

48000000 Software package and information systems

in months: 30 (from the award of the contract)

Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information
III.1)Conditions relating to the contract
III.1.1)Deposits and guarantees required:
III.1.2)Main financing conditions and payment arrangements and/or reference to the relevant provisions governing them:
III.1.3)Legal form to be taken by the group of economic operators to whom the contract is to be awarded:
III.1.4)Other particular conditions
The performance of the contract is subject to particular conditions: yes
Description of particular conditions: Frontex is looking for a solution based on COTS with a possibility to use OSS and develop a dedicated customisation for Frontex. That means Frontex needs to adjust its requirements during negotiations to general licencing schemes and guarantee models offered by tenderers. Therefore before requesting the submission of offers, Frontex intends to perform the competitive dialogue with a minimum of 3 and a maximum of 5 companies, with a possibility to gradually reduce the number of applicable solutions at the dialogue stage. Frontex will also run a few tests based on the use cases at the dialogue stage and is ready to cover the expenses of demo installation up to 5 000 EUR per company.
III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: Required proof that the tenderer is authorised to perform the contract under national law, as evidenced by inclusion in a trade or professional register, or a certificate of the membership of a specific organisation.
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: Candidate company's annual turnover for the last 3 financial years should be at the minimum level of 1 000 000 EUR per each year.
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
a) Tenderer's free format self-declaration of capability for selling, implementing, customising, providing trainings, providing on-the-spot support and maintaining digital assets management (DAM) and media assets management (MAM) systems is required.
b) Provision of a list containing of at least 3 successful projects delivered in the past 3 years and meeting jointly all the following criteria:
(i.) price of each project separately is equal or higher than 50 000 EUR;
(ii.) at least 2 projects cover DAM, MAM or MDAM (definition in the MDAM descriptive document, chapter 1);
(iii.) at least 1 of the projects was delivered in Europe.
The tenderer is also requested to provide the following information of the abovementioned referenced projects: a brief description, location, sums, dates and recipients, public or private.
c) Provision of a list of available tenderer's human resources, indicating the number of:
(i.) minimum of 2 managerial staff members who directly participated in the project(s) fulfilling all the characteristics listed in point (b) above at its complete life cycle in at least one of the following roles: contract manager, project manager, quality manager, system development manager, service manager, project assurance;
(ii.) minimum of 4 implementation consultants who directly participated in the complete life cycle of the project(s) fulfilling all the characteristics listed in point (b) above in scope of at least one of the following activities: analysis, development of the architecture, installation, customisations, developments, data migration, branding, testing and training;
(iii.) minimum of 3 maintenance and support specialists who directly provided maintenance and support services for longer than 1 year to the operator of the system delivered by the project(s) fulfilling all the characteristics listed in point (b) above.
Please note that provision of the list does not mean that all the listed experts will be working full-time on the project, they will be ready, though, to take the project over from the leading expert should the one be not available for some important reason.

Section II: Object of the contract
II.1)Description
II.1.1)Title attributed to the contract by the contracting authority:
Frontex positioning system.
II.1.2)Type of contract and location of works, place of delivery or of performance
Services
Service category No 27: Other services
Main site or location of works, place of delivery or of performance: Frontex HQ, Warsaw, Poland.

NUTS code PL127 Miasto Warszawa
II.1.3)Information about a public contract, a framework agreement or a dynamic purchasing system (DPS)
The notice involves a public contract
II.1.4)Information on framework agreement
II.1.5)Short description of the contract or purchase(s)
Frontex positioning system (FPS) concept aims to create a single, integrated, real-time automated system for tracking assets deployed in the Joint Operations (JO), and displaying positions of the assets in real time as well as calculating running costs of those assets, thus providing for automated procedures for assimilating and reporting financial data within the JO.
The aim of Frontex and the objective of this contract are to maintain and provide existing functionalities of the FPS for the JO, improved and developed according to the requirements defined. The FPS shall offer the capability to:
1) display positions of the assets in real time;
2) automatically calculate costs of the assets (per asset and JO);
3) be integrated with at least 5 third party positioning systems.
II.1.6)Common procurement vocabulary (CPV)

72000000 IT services: consulting, software development, Internet and support
II.1.7)Information about Government Procurement Agreement (GPA)
The contract is covered by the Government Procurement Agreement (GPA): no

This contract is divided into lots: no

Variants will be accepted: no

II.2.1)Total quantity or scope:

Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information
III.1)Conditions relating to the contract
III.1.1)Deposits and guarantees required:
III.1.2)Main financing conditions and payment arrangements and/or reference to the relevant provisions governing them:

III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: — the tenderer must be authorised to perform the prospective contract under the national law of the country it is established (or, in the case of a consortium, under the national law of the country of the consortium leader). Evidence of that must be provided by submission of a certificate of professional or commercial registration or a certificate of membership of a specific organisation.
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: — the tenderer must prove its stable financial position for at least 2 out of the past 3 financial years — 2011, 2012, 2013. Evidence of that must be provided by submission of self-declarations of the total annual turnovers and of the annual turnovers on services similar to those specified in the contract, carried out over all these past 3 years. The declarations must prove a substantial amount (i.e. minimum 200 000 EUR yearly) of similar services to those specified in the contract, contracted in at least 2 out of these past 3 years by the tenderer,
— the tenderer must prove its financial reliability for the past 3 financial years — 2011, 2012, 2013. Evidence of that must be provided by submission of relevant balance sheets (provided that the publication of balance sheets is stipulated by the legislation on firms in the country where the tenderer is established). If the tenderer is not required to publish its balance sheets, an explanation should be provided.
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
— the tenderer must have at least 3 years' experience in providing similar services. Evidence of that must be provided by submission of a list of contracts performed or deliveries executed in the years 2011, 2012 and 2013, with indicated sums, dates and recipients. The proper performance of the contracts listed above shall be documented in the form of a reference letter issued and signed by the authorised person of the particular tenderer's client (submission of a minimum of 2 reference letters from different customers, regarding contracts above the net financial value of 100 000 EUR, is required). The required reference letter should contain a brief description of the referenced project,
— the tenderer shall confirm possession of the necessary hardware and software for performance of the prospective assignment. Evidence of that must be provided by submission of a free-format self-statement,
— the tenderer must demonstrate its technical ability to provide all the services and products required in this call for tenders. Evidence of that must be provided by submission of a list of services which he can provide directly, as well as a list of services which the tenderer intends to subcontract (if applicable, with indication of the share of the prospective contract scope by the proposed subcontractors),
— the tenderer must prove its relevant personnel capacity to fulfil the tasks required under the prospective contract. Evidence of that must be provided by submission of a presentation of the team of experts who will conduct the work (with their CVs and a clear description of the roles and responsibilities of each of them). All the experts must have a working knowledge of English and perform in line with the security aspect letter rules (Annex F to Annex I).

Framework agreement with a single operator

Duration of the framework agreement
Duration in years: 4

Estimated total value of purchases for the entire duration of the framework agreement
Estimated value excluding VAT: 280 000 EUR
II.1.5)Short description of the contract or purchase(s)
Frontex intends to conclude a single framework contract with a professional and experienced reception services provider in order to ensure high quality of administrative services in the Agency's representative areas at Frontex premises. The framework contract shall be implemented by means of order forms issued, in principle, on a yearly basis for the permanent receptionists (4 persons intended). Individual order forms may be issued on an ad hoc basis to cover additional needs of Frontex arising in relation to the organised events. 4 permanent bilingual (Polish/English) receptionists shall provide reception services during working days of the Agency (Monday to Friday, except Frontex holidays) between 8:00 to 17:00 (regular office hours) at the Agency's premises.
II.1.6)Common procurement vocabulary (CPV)

75100000 Administration services

The contract shall be concluded for a period of 24 months with the possibility of 1 or 2 renewal(s) of 12 months. The total maximum duration of the framework contract shall not exceed 48 months.
The intended contract signature date is the second half of June 2014. The provision of the services shall start on 23.7.2014.
Estimated value excluding VAT: 280 000 EUR

Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information
III.1)Conditions relating to the contract
III.1.1)Deposits and guarantees required:
No deposits or guarantees are required.
III.1.2)Main financing conditions and payment arrangements and/or reference to the relevant provisions governing them:
Payments under the contract shall be made according to the time sheets against monthly invoices within 30 days of receipt of the relevant invoice submitted by the contractor. The invoice has to be accompanied by the copy of time sheets approved by the Head of the Agency Services.
III.1.3)Legal form to be taken by the group of economic operators to whom the contract is to be awarded:
No special legal form is required but, in the event that a group of contractors submits an acceptable offer, it shall be necessary to provide an undertaking that each company shall be jointly and severally responsible for the due performance of the contract. In the case of a consortium bid, the contractor shall be required to act on behalf of the consortium.
III.1.4)Other particular conditions
The performance of the contract is subject to particular conditions: no
III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: the tenderer shall declare by means of Annex III that none of the exclusion criteria apply;
the tenderer shall provide evidence that it is already established as a recognised legal entity and is registered in a relevant professional or trade register.
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: — the tenderer shall provide Frontex with its balance sheets for the past 3 financial years, on condition that the publication of balance sheets is stipulated by the legislation on firms in the country where the tenderer is established,
— the tenderer should provide a declaration of the total turnover and the turnover on the services specified in the contract carried out over the past 3 financial years. The total annual turnover shall be at least (equivalent of) 210 000 EUR for each year: 2011, 2012 and 2013.
Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required: The total annual turnover shall be at least (equivalent of) 210 000 EUR for each year: 2011, 2012 and 2013.
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
(a) the tenderer should be established as a recognised legal entity and be registered in a relevant professional or trade register. The proof of establishment/registration indicating the authorisation to perform the services to be contracted must be provided;
(b) the tenderer must have proven experience and expertise as well as HR capacity as a reception services provider for a minimum of 3 years, which shall be evidenced by:
— a comprehensive description of company profile,
— staffing chart, indicating in particular the persons meeting all the requirements of the receptionist's profile as described in point II.5,
— the list of companies to whom reception services were provided in the last 3 years with contact details for references,
— at least 3 reference letters confirming good quality of the reception services provided in the years 2011–2013,
— CVs of minimum 4, maximum 8 persons ('the team') meeting all the requirements of the receptionist's profile proposed for the contract.
Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required:
proven experience of a minimum of 3 years in providing reception services;
at least 3 reference letters confirming good quality of the reception services provided in the years 2011–2013;
CVs of minimum 4, maximum 8 persons ('the team') meeting all the requirements of the receptionist's profile proposed for the contract.

II.1.2)Type of contract and location of works, place of delivery or of performance
Services
Service category No 11: Management consulting services [6] and related services
Main site or location of works, place of delivery or of performance: Warsaw, Poland.
NUTS code
II.1.3)Information about a public contract, a framework agreement or a dynamic purchasing system (DPS)
The notice involves a public contract
II.1.4)Information on framework agreement
II.1.5)Short description of the contract or purchase(s)
There is a legal requirement for Frontex every 5 years to be evaluated by an external, independent body commissioned for this purpose. This external evaluation shall enable the management board to assess the implementation of the Frontex Regulation. The findings and recommendations in the future evaluation report will also provide the management board with adequate information for issuing recommendations to the European Commission on possible changes to the Frontex Regulation, the Agency, and its working practices. Both the findings and recommendations will be made public pursuant to Article 33 of the Frontex Regulation.
II.1.6)Common procurement vocabulary (CPV)

II.3)Duration of the contract or time limit for completion

Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information
III.1)Conditions relating to the contract
III.1.1)Deposits and guarantees required:
III.1.2)Main financing conditions and payment arrangements and/or reference to the relevant provisions governing them:
Initial payment of 25 % after the inception report has been accepted; interim payment of 25 % after the interim progress report has been accepted; final payment of 50 % after acceptance of all deliverables.
III.1.3)Legal form to be taken by the group of economic operators to whom the contract is to be awarded:
III.1.4)Other particular conditions
The performance of the contract is subject to particular conditions: no
III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: As stated in the tender specifications.
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: The tenderer shall provide evidence of its economic and financial capacity to perform the contract as follows:
— annual turnover for 2 years of any of the 3 last financial years must be equal to or greater than 1 000 000 EUR separately for each year.
This evaluation shall be based on the following balance sheets, or summaries thereof (where these exist) for which accounts have been closed, where publication of balance sheets is prescribed under company law in the country in which the economic operator is resident. If, for a substantiated valid reason, the tenderer is unable to provide them, he/she must enclose a statement as to turnover.
Should the application be submitted by a grouping, the information related to turnover above must be submitted in the form of a separate document for each grouping member and subcontractors and a document summarising the consolidated turnover for the grouping as a whole.
For the public entities and international organisations participating in the tendering procedure, the annual budget instead of yearly turnover will be taken into account.
The obligation of a tenderer to submit the documentary evidence referred to in this point is waived for a particular year if such evidence has already been submitted to Frontex for that year for the purposes of another procurement procedure and still complies with the requirements of this point. The tenderer is, however, obliged to indicate the reference number of that procurement procedure.
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
The tenderer shall provide evidence of its technical and professional capacity to perform the contract as follows:
(a) proof that the tenderer is authorised to perform the contract under national law, as evidenced by inclusion in a trade or professional register, or a sworn declaration or certificate, or membership of a specific organisation; a printout as evidence is sufficient if the inclusion is available via the Internet. In the opposite case, a certificate is required. In case no proof of registration is issued in a country of origin, a sworn declaration by the tenderer will be accepted;
(b) a list of at least 5 successful projects delivered in the past 4 years and meeting jointly all the following criteria:
i. price of at least 1 project is equal to or higher than 250 000 EUR;
ii. at least 3 projects shall cover evaluation or studies or assessment of EU home affairs policies or home affairs legislation or home affairs programmes or other related activities including border management; projects of the value below 15 000 EUR shall not be considered.
The list of successful projects shall contain a brief description of each project, with sums, dates, location and customers (recipients) both public and/or private;
(c) at least 4 letters of recommendation issued by former customers, including at least 3 letters of recommendation covering any of the positions from the list defined under point (b)ii;
(d) experience with applying quality assurance methodology in the work of the offerer needs to be evidenced by any means;
(e) experience in integrated border management needs to be evidenced by any means;
(f) a team composed of at least 5 members including 2 senior experts with at least 5 years of professional experience in integrated border management;
(g) documents demonstrating that the team members can execute the contract and deliver the report(s) in English.

Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information
III.1)Conditions relating to the contract
III.1.1)Deposits and guarantees required:
III.1.2)Main financing conditions and payment arrangements and/or reference to the relevant provisions governing them:
III.1.3)Legal form to be taken by the group of economic operators to whom the contract is to be awarded:
III.1.4)Other particular conditions
III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: Lots 1 & 2: legal capacity:
A tenderer is asked to prove that he is authorised to perform the contract under national law as evidenced by inclusion in a trade or professional register, or a sworn declaration or certificate, membership in a specific organisation.
Evidence required:
— a certificate of professional or commercial registration imposed by the country in which the tenderer is established. If the tenderer is not required or permitted to enrol in such a register for reasons of his statute or legal status, an explanation should be provided.
The tenderer shall also provide a duly filled in and signed legal entity form (see Appendix 1 to Annex I) accompanied by the documents requested therein, as well as a duly filled in and signed financial identification form (see Appendix 2 to Annex I) accompanied by the documents requested therein.
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: Lot 1: the tenderer shall provide evidence of its economic and financial capacity to perform the contract as follows:
— the tenderer shall provide Frontex with its balance sheets for the past 3 financial years, on condition that the publication of balance sheets is stipulated by the legislation on firms in the country where the tenderer is established,
— the tenderer shall provide Frontex with a declaration of the total turnover carried out over the past 3 years,
— the tenderer shall provide Frontex with a declaration of the turnover generated on services similar to those specified in this call for tenders carried out over the past 3 years. This total turnover shall indicate a minimum amount of 150 000 EUR per year for catering services over the last 3 years.
The obligation of a tenderer to submit the documentary evidence referred to in this point is waived for a particular year if such evidence has already been submitted to Frontex for that year for the purposes of another procurement procedure and still complies with requirements of this point. The tenderer is in such cases obliged to indicate the reference number of that procurement procedure.
Lot 2: the tenderer shall provide evidence of its economic and financial capacity to perform the contract as follows:
— the tenderer shall provide Frontex with its balance sheets for the past 3 financial years, on condition that the publication of balance sheets is stipulated by the legislation on firms in the country where the tenderer is established,
— the tenderer shall provide Frontex with a declaration of the total turnover carried out over the past 3 years,
— the tenderer shall provide Frontex with a declaration of the turnover generated on services similar to those specified in this call for tenders carried out over the past 3 years. This total turnover shall indicate a minimum amount of 240 000 EUR for the last 3 years in total.
The obligation of a tenderer to submit the documentary evidence referred to in this point is waived for a particular year if such evidence has already been submitted to Frontex for that year for the purposes of another procurement procedure and still complies with requirements of this point. The tenderer is in such cases obliged to indicate the reference number of that procurement procedure.
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
Lot 1: the tenderer shall provide evidence of its technical and professional capacity to perform the contract as follows:
— the tenderer must have at least 3 years of professional experience in providing similar services, i.e. delivering catering services and running a canteen of minimum 100 seats or for 200 people,
— the tenderer must prove and demonstrate its relevant personnel capacity and technical ability to provide all the services required under the prospective contract.
Evidence required:
The following documents and/or information shall be presented as evidence of compliance with the technical and professional capacity criteria listed above:
— a short overview on the company portfolio confirming the tenderer's professional experience,
— a list and brief description of recent activities in the field of catering services and canteen management, together with a list of contracts above the value of 10 000 EUR or equivalent, performed in the past 3 years, with sums, dates and recipients (public and/or private),
— reference letters (related to the abovementioned list of contracts above the value of 10 000 EUR or equivalent) issued and signed by clients confirming timely delivery and good quality of services provided (a minimum of 3 reference letters regarding contracts for similar catering services and at least 1 reference letter regarding a canteen with at least 100 seats/serving food for at least 200 people); self-declarations by tenderers shall not be accepted,
— curricula vitae detailing the educational and professional qualifications of the canteen and catering manager, chef and sous-chef, each one together with a certificate of clean criminal record. The tenderer must be able to provide a team matching the requirements detailed in point 11 of the terms of reference for lot 1,
— a list of names and functions of the other staff designated to perform the contract,
— a copy of valid permissions and/or licences necessary to provide the services required in the terms of reference for lot 1,
— a copy of valid civil liability insurance, concluded for an amount not lower than 100 000 EUR or equivalent, issued for the tenderer.
Only the offers that meet the selection criteria shall pass to the second stage of the evaluation.
The obligation of a tenderer to submit the documentary evidence referred to in this point is waived for a particular year if such evidence has already been submitted to Frontex for that year for the purposes of another procurement procedure and still complies with requirements of this point. The tenderer is however obliged to indicate the reference number of that procurement procedure.
Lot 2: the tenderer shall provide evidence of its technical and professional capacity to perform the contract as follows:
— the tenderer must have at least 3 years' experience in providing similar services i.e. supply, installation and maintenance of kitchen equipment in similar settings,
— the tenderer must prove and demonstrate its relevant personnel capacity and technical ability to provide all the services required under the prospective contract.
Evidence required:
The following documents and/or information shall be presented as evidence of compliance with the technical and professional capacity criteria listed above:
— a short overview on the company portfolio confirming the tenderer's professional experience,
— a list and brief description of recent activities in the field of kitchen and catering equipment delivery and maintenance, together with a list of contracts above the value of 10 000 EUR or equivalent, performed in the past 3 years, with sums, dates and recipients (public and/or private),
— reference letters (related to the abovementioned list of contracts above the value of 10 000 EUR or equivalent) issued and signed by clients confirming timely delivery and good quality of services provided (a minimum of 3 reference letters regarding contracts for delivering kitchen equipment and provision of maintenance services in the past 3 years); self-declarations by tenderers shall not be accepted,
— a copy of valid permissions and/or licences of the staff designated to provide the services mentioned in the terms of reference for lot 2; the staff must have at least 1 year of experience in the installation of kitchen and catering equipment and provision of maintenance services,
— a copy of valid civil liability insurance, concluded for an amount not lower than 80 000 EUR or equivalent, issued for the tenderer.
Only the offers that meet the selection criteria shall pass to the second stage of the evaluation.
The obligation of a tenderer to submit the documentary evidence referred to in this point is waived for a particular year if such evidence has already been submitted to Frontex for that year for the purposes of another procurement procedure and still complies with requirements of this point. The tenderer is however obliged to indicate the reference number of that procurement procedure.

III.2)Conditions for participation
III.2.1)Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: The tenderer is already established as a recognised legal entity and is registered in a relevant professional or trade register; a certificate of professional or commercial registration imposed by the country in which the tenderer is established must be presented. If the tenderer is not required or permitted to enrol in such a register for reasons of his statute or legal status, an explanation should be provided (legal capacity).
III.2.2)Economic and financial ability
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: a) the tenderer shall provide Frontex with its profit and loss accounts and balance sheets for the past 3 financial years for which accounts have been closed, on condition that the publication of profit and loss account and balance sheets is stipulated by the legislation on firms in the country where the tenderer is established; in cases when a company was created less than 3 years ago it is obliged to deliver financial evidence only for the period of its existence;
b) the tenderer shall provide Frontex with a declaration of the company's total turnover from the past 3 years for which accounts have been closed (information shall be provided separately for each year); the average turnover over the last 3 years (or from the period of existence of a company if it was created less than 3 years ago) must be greater than 1 000 000 EUR.
III.2.3)Technical capacity
Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met:
a) the tenderer shall possess a partnership certificate issued by the manufacturer of the storage; a copy of such partnership certificate must be presented;
b) the tender shall present its portfolio, displaying relevant projects implemented in the last 3 years (or in the period of existence of a company if it was created less than 3 years ago) with sums, dates and customer names and containing at least 3 contracts for delivering goods and services for projects similar to the one described in the tender dossier;
c) the tenderer shall provide letters signed by the authorised persons or certificates, issued or countersigned by the customers to demonstrate the proper performance of at least 3 contracts listed above;
d) the tenderer shall be able to provide a team of consultants matching the requirements of the terms of reference.

Section IV: Procedure
IV.1)Type of procedure

Open
IV.2)Award criteria

The most economically advantageous tender in terms of

Poland-Warsaw: Framework contract for maintenance and evolution of the Eurosur network

2014/S 013-017853

Contract award notice

Services
Directive 2004/18/EC

Section I: Contracting authority
I.1)Name, addresses and contact point(s)

Official name: European Agency for the Management of Operational Cooperation at the External Borders of the Member States of the European Union — Frontex
Postal address: Rondo ONZ 1
Town: Warsaw
Postal code: 00-124
Country: Poland
E-mail: procurement@frontex.europa.eu
Telephone: +48 222059500
Fax: +48 222059501

Internet address(es):

General address of the contracting authority: http://www.frontex.europa.eu
I.2)Type of the contracting authority
European institution/agency or international organisation
I.3)Main activity
I.4)Contract award on behalf of other contracting authorities
The contracting authority is purchasing on behalf of other contracting authorities: no

Section II: Object of the contract
II.1)Description
II.1.1)Title attributed to the contract
Framework contract for maintenance and evolution of the Eurosur network.
II.1.2)Type of contract and location of works, place of delivery or of performance
Services
Service category No 7: Computer and related services
Main site or location of works, place of delivery or of performance: Frontex premises, Warsaw, Poland.
Some services relevant to the provision of maintenance and support may need to be provided at the contractor's premises or at the location of the nodes in the territory of the EU and Schengen associated countries.

NUTS code PL127 Miasto Warszawa
II.1.3)Information about a framework agreement or a dynamic purchasing system (DPS)
The notice involves the establishment of a framework agreement
II.1.4)Short description of the contract or purchase(s)
The aim of this framework contract is to evolve the Eurosur network from its pilot phase into a stable service aligned with the Eurosur legislation.
Eurosur is a distributed, Web-based, developed in Java and OSS technologies, GIS intensive, information exchange system. It provides a persistent connection between Member States and Frontex using a fully extensible information sharing system to support secure 'information trade' between the corresponding national coordination centres and the national coordination centres and Frontex. Eurosur network is composed of different nodes, with their corresponding hardware and software.
Eurosur uses a set of secure peer-to-peer Internet connections that allows its nodes to use services to exchange information on irregular migration and related border crime. The Eurosur Technical Office, providing master services and support to the network and nodes, is an integral part of Eurosur.
The maintenance and support of the network as well as its evolution are objectives of this framework.
Evolution of the network should be understood as activities including but not limited to: design, development, implementation and deployment of the new functionalities.
More specifically, the framework contract shall cover the following main areas:
a. Eurosur evolution:
— extension of the Eurosur network to new nodes to encompass all current and future Member States, Schengen associated countries and selected EU agencies,
— improving system stability & reliability of Eurosur nodes and applications suite,
— extending Eurosur nodes accessibility by local users and systems,
— development of Eurosur staging and training environments,
— enhancement of network security,
— enhancement of Eurosur application following usage evolution;
b. Eurosur support and maintenance:
— daily operation of Eurosur network,
— maintenance & support of the Eurosur network and applications suite,
— establishment and management of a central spare part stock.
II.1.5)Common procurement vocabulary (CPV)

72000000 IT services: consulting, software development, Internet and support
II.1.6)Information about Government Procurement Agreement (GPA)
The contract is covered by the Government Procurement Agreement (GPA): no
II.2)Total final value of contract(s)
II.2.1)Total final value of contract(s)
Value: 12 000 000 EUR
Excluding VAT
